title: Adam Sandler's daughters join him on stage as they perform adorable cover of Taylor Swift's Lover
text:
Last week he revealed he'd have no problem with his daughters following him into the entertainment field.

And Adam Sandler's kids Sadie, 13, and Sunny, 10 showed they might just have what it takes to succeed on Sunday, when they joined their Billy Madison star dad onstage at the Rock4EB! fundraiser in Malibu.

The girls belted out an adorable version of Taylor Swift's song Lover, while accompanied by their 53-year-old dad on guitar, in video captured by The Hollywood Reporter's Chris Gardner.

Scroll down to see the video

Good genes! Adam Sandler's kids Sadie, 13, [center] and Sunny, 10 [L] showed they might just have what it takes to succeed on Sunday, when they joined their Billy Madison star dad onstage at the Rock4EB! fundraiser in Malibu

Performing in front of such luminaries as Julia Roberts, Sean Penn, Courteney Cox, Kaley Cuoco and Rami Malek, the kids joined their dad onstage after he performed some standup for the A-list crowd.

The event was to raise funds for the rare genetic skin condition epidermolysis bullosa.

In his introduction, Sandler said the daughters he shares with wife Jacqueline Titone had 'been so excited and nervous' about performing.

However once they began singing they performed a near flawless rendition of the pop song - albeit with amusingly tweaked lines such as changing 'Hanukkah lights' to 'Christmas lights'.

There are many, many highlights I recorded from tonight’s #Rock4EB but this one is pretty special. @AdamSandler handling guitar duties while his daughters Sunny & Sadie sing @taylorswift13 “Lover” in front of Julia Roberts, Sean Penn, etc. They’re major Swifties, and so good too pic.twitter.com/Z589j4tDBJ — Chris Gardner (@chrissgardner) October 7, 2019

Here’s part 2 also, they just flew in this morning after catching @taylorswift13 on @nbcsnl last night. pic.twitter.com/eGB3mMY3qu — Chris Gardner (@chrissgardner) October 7, 2019

Stars-in-training: They girls belted out an adorable version of Taylor Swift's song Lover, while accompanied by their 53-year-old dad on guitar

Many stars such as Mila Kunis have shared their hope for their children to not follow their steps in show business.

However, Adam revealed last week he'd be more than on-board if his daughters -who are already showing signs of being musicians - entered the entertainment field.

The Happy Gilmore funnyman's daughters have no fear of stage fright and frequently take to the stage to showcase their talents.

He's got their back: Adam Sandler said he was happy to encourage his daughter's interests in show-business after they both showed interest and talent in singing (pictured 2019)

'Both my daughters come on stage and sing sometimes because they're on the road with me all the time,' he told Us Weekly.

'They like to sing … and they see Daddy up there and they're like, "Can I try that?" So I say, "Get on up there".'

Adam continued to express that whether it's singing or not, he's got their back

Supportive dad: 'Whatever they’re excited about in their lives, I’ll back them up' (pictured 2016)

'Whatever they’re excited about in their lives, I’ll back them up.'

Sunny recently took to the stage with her dad during his comedy show in New Jersey to belt out A Million Dreams from The Greatest Showman.

As for Adam, he's been working with the Safdies brothers, Josh and Benny for his role in Uncut Gems.

Playing a jewellery store owner and dealer whose life gets turned upside down following a robbery, he said his experience made him feel 'very free.'

New role: Playing a jewelry store owner and dealer whose life gets turned upside down following a robbery, he said his experience made him feel 'very free'

'It felt good. It's very free, in a way. You don't know where the cameras are, and sometimes you don't know what you're shooting,' he told The Hollywood Reporter.

'Sometimes I didn't know whether it was a close-up or far away, if I was blocking my face or where to look. The cameras were in positions that I hadn't seen before, so I didn't know what was happening.'

He continued: 'It was very New York in that way.'

Uncut Gems is scheduled for release on December 13, 2019.

Adam has been married to model-actress, Jacqueline Titone, since 2003. She converted to Judaism to be with him.

The couple welcomed Sadie in May 2006 and Sunny in November 2008.
description: Adam Sandler's kids Sadie, 13, and Sunny, 10 showed they might just have what it takes to succeed on Sunday, when they joined their Billy Madison star dad onstage.
